Package presentation

Class BlockAreaCanvas

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Canvas
presentation.BlockAreaCanvas
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class BlockAreaCanvas
extends java.awt.Canvas
Canvas used to draw the program blocks on. Also contains logic to handle mouse and key presses.
Version:
4.0
Author:
Andreas Awouters Thomas Van Erum Dirk Vanbeveren Geert Wesemael
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • BlockAreaCanvas

      public BlockAreaCanvas​(BlockrPanel blockrPanel, game_world.api.FacadeGameWorld iGameWorld)
      Initialize the BlockAreaCanvas with the given Blockr Panel and Gameworld Facade.
      Parameters:
      blockrPanel - The panel to attach this blockAreaCanvas to.
      iGameWorld - Interface used by the panel.

  • Method Details

    • paint

      public void paint​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Draw the blockArea Canvas This includes the blocks from the palette and the blocks currently forming the program.
      Overrides:
      paint in class java.awt.Canvas

    • setErrorMessage

      private void setErrorMessage​(java.lang.String errorMessage)
      Set the error message shown by the blockAreaCanvas
      Parameters:
      errorMessage - String of the error message to be shown.

    • handleMousePressed

      public void handleMousePressed​(int x, int y)
      Handle a mouse button press at the given location. When a block is clicked in the palette a functional copy of that block is created at the mouse location. When a block in the programArea is clicked, the block is picked up.
      Parameters:
      x - Horizontal value of the location of the mouse press.
      y - Vertical value of the location of the mouse press.

    • copyPaletteBlockIntoProgramArea

      private void copyPaletteBlockIntoProgramArea​(PresentationBlock<?> paletteBlockP)
      Make a copy from the given PresentationBlock and add it to the ProgramArea. If the given block is a Presentation of the FunctionDefinitonBlock, create a FunctionCall PresentationBlock in the Palette with the same ID.
      Parameters:
      paletteBlockP - The block that is getting copied in the ProgramArea.

    • pickBlockUpFromProgramArea

      private void pickBlockUpFromProgramArea​(PresentationBlock<?> programBlockP)
      Pick up the selected block from the programArea.
      Parameters:
      programBlockP - The presentation Block in the ProgramArea that we are going to pick up.

    • handleMouseDragged

      public void handleMouseDragged​(int x, int y)
      Handle the mouse being dragged to the given location. When a block is selected, the block will be repainted at the new location.
      Parameters:
      x - horizontal value of the location the mouse is dragged to.
      y - vertical value of the location the mouse is dragged to.

    • handleMouseReleased

      public void handleMouseReleased​(int x, int y)
      Handle a mouse being released at the given location. Reset all the command and information about the mouse. When a block is selected delete it when the given location is over the palette, drop the block otherwise.
      Parameters:
      x - Horizontal value of the location of the mouse release.
      y - Vertical value of the location of the mouse release.

    • removeSelectedBlockFromProgramArea

      private void removeSelectedBlockFromProgramArea()
      Remove the selected block from the programArea.

    • dropBlockInProgramArea

      private void dropBlockInProgramArea()
      Drop the selected block in the ProgramArea.

    • handleKeyPressed

      public void handleKeyPressed​(java.awt.event.KeyEvent key)
      Handle a key press.
      Parameters:
      key - KeyEvent to be handled.

    • run

      void run()
      When possible run the program, otherwise set the error message to the reason why the game can't run.

    • newGameWorld

      void newGameWorld()
      Set a new random GameWorld.

    • undo

      void undo()
      Undo the last change.

    • redo

      void redo()
      Redo the last undo.

    • stopExecution

      private void stopExecution()
      Stop the execution of the current program.
